value.name: Temple of Caesar - Wikipedia
value.snippet: The Temple of Caesar or Temple of Divus Iulius (Latin: Aedes Divi Iuli; Italian: Tempio del Divo Giulio), also known as Temple of the Deified Julius Caesar, delubrum, heroon or Temple of the Comet Star, is an ancient structure in the Roman Forum of Rome, Italy, located near the Regia and the Temple of Vesta.

value.name: Temple of Caesar - History and Facts | History Hit
value.snippet: The Temple of Caesar stands on the east side of the main square of the Roman Forum, between the Regia, Temple of Castor and Pollux, and the Basilica Aemilia. As a result visitors can spend the day wandering between and enjoying the different sites that the forum has to offer.

value.name: The Temple of Caesar in the Roman Forum: a Pilgrimage to the Grave of ...
value.snippet: The Temple of Caesar, or Temple of Divus Iulius Octavian became Rome’s first emperor, calling himself Augustus. When he built the temple, Augutus’ motives weren’t completely altruistic. He knew it would help cement his power to associate himself with the deified Caesar. As time went on, however, the purpose of the temple changed.

value.name: Temple of Caesar - Photo Archive
value.snippet: The Temple of Caesar (Aedes Divus Iulius or Templum Divi Iuli) was built by Augustus after the senate deified Julius Caesar after his death. The temple was dedicated August 18th, 29 BCE. It stands on the E. side of the main square of the Forum Romanum , between the Regia , Temple of Castor and Pollux and the the Basilica Aemilia .

value.name: Temple of Caesar, Rome, Italy - Sightseeing Tours Italy
value.snippet: The Temple of Caesar. When Emperor Augustus came to rule, he decided to build a temple devoted to Julius Caesar. His reasons weren’t completely selfless, as he knew it would improve his popularity and power if he associated with the sacred Caesar. However, after some time had passed, this temple’s purpose began to change.

value.name: Temple of Caesar - HistoryTen
value.snippet: Temple of Caesar, otherwise known as Temple of Divus Iulius, Temple of the Deified Julius Caesar, or the Temple of the Comet Star, is situated in Via della Salara Vecchia, just beyond two temples – Temple of Vesta and the Regia. It is also about 12 to 15 minutes away from the Mausoleum of Augustus and on Campus Martius.

value.snippet: The Temple of Caesar's Layout and Floor Plan The layout of the Temple of Caesar consisted of five main parts: the naos, the pronaos, the entablature and pediment, the podium, and the altar. The...

value.snippet: The Temple of Caesar or Temple of Divus Iulius (Latin: Aedes Divi Iuli; Italian: Tempio del Divo Giulio), also known as Temple of the Deified Julius Caesar, delubrum, heroon or Temple of the Comet Star, is an ancient structure in the Roman Forum of Rome, Italy, located near the Regia and the Temple of Vesta.

value.name: Where is tomb of Caesar? « IMPERIUM ROMANUM
value.snippet: View of the ruins of the Temple of the Divine Caesar in the Forum Romanum in Rome. It is said that this is where the body of the murdered dictator was to be cremated. | Photo: Michał Kubicz. When visiting the Forum Romanum, many people notice flowers placed in the niche of the wall of Caesar’s temple in memory of his memory.
